Legal_Issue: Whether an adjudicator has jurisdiction to order a detention review hearing outside the detention facility
Burden_of_Proof: On the Minister to demonstrate jurisdictional error
Legal_Rule: Hearings must be held in detention facilities unless confidentiality or public safety concerns arise; Rule 7 allows location changes but is limited by Rule 30
Procedural_Issue: Relocation of hearing from detention center to IRB offices
Grounds_for_Claim: Adjudicator exceeded jurisdiction by moving hearing outside detention facility
Outcome_on_Merits: Court ruled in favor of the Minister
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Not explicitly addressed, but procedural rules were emphasized
Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of facilities at detention center, public access, witness participation
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB) Rules of Procedure
Applicant_Challenge: Minister challenged adjudicatorâ€™s authority to change venue
Court_Result: Judicial review allowed; hearing must occur in detention facility
Legal_Rule_Source: Subsection 103(9) of the Immigration Act, Rule 7 and Rule 30 of IRB Rules
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (implied for judicial review context)
Defendant_Response: Adjudicator justified relocation based on practical hearing considerations
Remedy_Requested: Set aside adjudicator's decision on jurisdictional grounds
Remedy_Sought: Declaration that adjudicator acted beyond jurisdiction
Legal_Provision: Immigration Act, s. 103(9); IRB Rule 7; IRB Rule 30
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration Act, subsection 103(9); IRB Rule 7; IRB Rule 30
Applicable_Process: Detention review hearing under Immigration Act
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Detention review hearing to proceed within detention facility
Jurisdiction: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration adjudicator decisions
